{{Use British English|date=September 2013}} {{Infobox airport | name = RAF Limavady
RNAS Limavady | nativename = [[File:Ensign of the Royal Air Force.svg|90px]][[File:Naval Ensign of the United Kingdom.svg|90px]] | nativename-a = | nativename-r = | image = | image-width = | caption = | IATA = | ICAO = | type = Military | owner = [[Air Ministry]] | operator = [[Royal Air Force]] | city-served = Limavady Borough | location = [[County Londonderry|Londonderry]], [[Northern Ireland]] | built = {{Start date|df=yes|1940}} | used = 1940-{{End date|df=yes|1958}} | elevation-f = 65 | elevation-m = 19.8 | coordinates = {{Coord|55|04|23|N|006|56|15|W|region:GB_type:airport|display=inline,title}} | latd = 55 | latm = 04 | lats = 23 | latNS = N | longd= 006 | longm= 56 | longs= 15 | longEW= W | coordinates_type = airport | coordinates_region = Northern Ireland | pushpin_map = Northern Ireland | pushpin_label = RAF Limavady | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Northern Ireland }} '''Royal Air Force Station Limavady''' or more simply '''RAF Limavady''' is a former [[Royal Air Force station]], also known as Aghanloo airfield, near the city of [[Derry]], [[Northern Ireland]]. ==Beginnings== The station was built in 1940 during the [[Second World War]]. ==Squadrons== {| class="wikitable sortable" border="1" |- ! Sqn !! Aircraft !! Joined !! Departed !! From > To !! Notes |- | [[No. 48 Squadron RAF|48]] || [[Avro Anson]] I
[[Bristol Beaufort]] I
[[Lockheed Hudson]] V/III || 16 July 1940 || 20 October 1941 || [[RAF Hooton Park]]
[[RAF Stornoway]]
[[RAF Skitten]] || On detachment initially from [[RAF Hooton Park]] then squadron moved to [[RAF Stornoway]] then on to [[RAF Skitten]].Jefford, p.44 (No. 48 Sqn) |- | [[No. 53 Squadron RAF|53]] || [[Lockheed Hudson]] V || July 1941 || February 1942 || [[RAF Bircham Newton]] > [[RAF St Eval]] || On detachment then squadron moved to RAF St Eval and continued its detachment.Jefford, p.45 (No. 53 Sqn) |- | [[No. 143 Squadron RAF|143]] || [[Bristol Blenheim]] IV || 23 April 1942 || 11 June 1942 || [[RAF Aldergrove]] > [[RAF Thorney Island]] || Squadron move.Jefford, p.64 (No. 143 Sqn) |- | [[No. 153 Squadron RAF|153]] || [[Boulton Paul Defiant]] I
[[Bristol Beaufighter]] IF || October 1941 || December 1942 || [[RAF Ballyhalbert]] > [[RAF Portreath]] || On detachment.Jefford, p.65 (No. 153 Sqn) |- | [[No. 172 Squadron RAF|172]] || [[Vickers Wellington]] XIV || 1 September 1944 || 4 June 1945 || [[RAF Chivenor]] > DB || Squadron disbanded.Jefford, p.67 (No. 172 Sqn) |- | [[No. 221 Squadron RAF|221]] || [[Vickers Wellington]] IC || November 1940 || 25 December 1941 || [[RAF Bircham Newton]] > [[RAF Docking]] || On detachment from [[RAF Bircham Newton]] then from RAF Reykjavik.Jefford, p.75 (No. 221 Sqn) |- | [[No. 224 Squadron 30 May 1941 || 22 March 1942 || [[RAF Bircham Newton]] > [[RAF Stornoway]] || On detachment then squadron move.Jefford, p.95 (No. 500 Sqn) |- | [[No. 502 Squadron RAF|502]] || [[Armstrong Whitworth Whitley]] V || 27 January 1941 || 10 January 1942 || [[RAF Aldergrove]] > [[RAF Bircham Newton]] || Squadron move.Jefford, p.96 (No. 502 Sqn) |- | [[No. 612 Squadron RAF|612]] || [[Armstrong Whitworth Whitley]] V || 1 April 1941 || 15 December 1941 || [[RAF Wick]] > [[RAF Reykjavik]] || On detachment then squadron move.Jefford, p.101 (No. 612 Sqn) |} After the Second World War the airfield was further used by the [[Fleet Air Arm]] when it was known as RNAS Limavady until 1958 when it was finally sold off. ==Current use== {{Empty section|date=October 2013}} ==References== ===Citations===
